intro: Lophiolepis vallis-demonii subsp. vallis-demonii, commonly known as the Valles-Demon plant, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in a dense, terminal spike, which bloom during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
